last_episode_to_air.name: Double Dare
last_episode_to_air.overview: FOTP sketches include banned scenes from Double Dare (starring Marc Summers), a man afflicted with waffle hands, and bone-crunching action from the Concussion League. Plus, guest star David Alan Grier fires a super hero.

name: Friends of the People
overview: A fresh and unique take on sketch comedy, with a combination of scripted sketches, man-on-the-street segments and more.

episodes.name: Meet the Friends
episodes.overview: Tracy Morgan Freeman; a man with a hyperactive brain worm; the Lucas Brothers debate Squabblin' and Quarrelin'; man-on-the-street interviews. The series premiere.

episodes.name: The Horror
episodes.overview: An audacious mother; a pizza interrupts a stakeout; a rap about Brooklyn thug life; high school horrors revisited.

episodes.name: Hustle Gods
episodes.overview: Urkel's ascent to stardom; a quirky dunk contest; getting stuff for free; a big race.

episodes.name: Beached Brothas
episodes.overview: The secret lives of frat guys; Beached Brothers songs; parenting PSAs; Rel gets pranked; free advice on the streets of NYC.

episodes.name: Pick-Up Artists
episodes.overview: A look at a beauty pageant exploiting the worst parent ever. Plus what the Lucas brothers make of the 'Transformers' movie. Tracey Morgan Freeman wreaks havoc at a White House Dinner. Jen gets a unusual bike riding lesson and the cast cross the street to avoid fears.

episodes.name: Welcome to Hammer Time
episodes.overview: An overly dramatic driving instructor takes students on a ride they won't forget in a hurry. A retrospective look at the Lucas Bros Squabblin' and Quarrelin'. Josh's dancing abilities are put to the test and a trip to a alternate dimension.

episodes.name: Never Come Back
episodes.overview: The FOTP cast shakes things up with sketches that include; the Little Richard app for life's most irritating moments, musical musings on the best dressed guy in basketball, and a detective keen on solving a particularly smelly crime. Plus, the cast roasts Kevin and Jermaine on the streets of NYC.

episodes.name: The Story Behind Real Tweets
episodes.overview: A Lucas Bros parody of Mars Blackmon, the Untold Hollywood History of Walter the black Power Ranger.

episodes.name: Black Kids of Bayside
episodes.overview: The FOTP introduce sketches that include; the plight of house hunters in Gotham City, a preacher who suffers with an ungodly Wi-Fi connection, and a virginity story that ends in tragedy and jail time. Plus, the cast goes toe-to-toe with Mr. Belding, and Josh talks to New Yorkers about the amusements of subway riding.

episodes.name: Return of the Old Killers
episodes.overview: A post-apocalyptic debate on acceptable rat consumption and an intervention for selfie addiction.

episodes.name: Black Mad Men
episodes.overview: A million dollar game show heist; a date turned barely legal; a superhero with the power of song; guest starring Brian McKnight.

episodes.name: Bubble Brawl
episodes.overview: The FOTP introduce sketches that include; the plight of house hunters in Gotham City, a preacher who suffers with an ungodly Wi-Fi connection, and a virginity story that ends in tragedy and jail time.

episodes.name: C'mon Dad!
episodes.overview: Skeches include: a bathroom line leader; a cinema classic redone by the Lucas brothers. Also, on-the-street interviews are conducted.

episodes.name: Tag Team
episodes.overview: FOTP brings sketches including a product pitchman with poor pronunciation, a crime scene cover-up that gets squirrely and the return of Mr. Huffton. Plus, the cast tags in Jake the Snake, Mick Foley, and X-Pac for some high impact back-up.

episodes.name: Never Come Back Again
episodes.overview: An animator's struggle to conceal his x-rated art; a high school basketball player dying for super powers; a pre-historic narcotics officer.

episodes.name: Ghetto Blessings
episodes.overview: The FOTP gang explores the rise and fall of The California Raisins with guest Jeff Ross, a party is ruined by the president, and the Lucas Brothers try their hand at Star Wars. Plus, see why ghetto living is a blessing in disguise.

episodes.name: Great White Haters
episodes.overview: FOTP brings the funny with financially-savvy rap stars, an indestructible award-winning actress, and guest star Ed Lover challenges an obscure 1980's action hero. Plus, Great White Haters show how racism historically backfires.

episodes.name: Kings of Gold
episodes.overview: FOTP reveals the epic horrors of your friends finding your unlocked phone, Lil Rel and guest star, Deon Cole's heartfelt PSA turns into a canine vendetta, and special guest Jim Norton visits the set of Master P Wee's Playhouse.

episodes.name: Hood Beef
episodes.overview: FOTP brings justice served Lucas Bros-style, an unusually timid hood beef with guest star J.D. Williams, and wrestling stars, D'Lo Brown and Tatanka. Plus, Eric Andre makes an appearance to discuss a media mogul's controversial purchase.

episodes.name: Double Dare
episodes.overview: FOTP sketches include banned scenes from Double Dare (starring Marc Summers), a man afflicted with waffle hands, and bone-crunching action from the Concussion League. Plus, guest star David Alan Grier fires a super hero.
